passage_text: August is the hottest month in Costa del Sol with an average temperature of 26°C (79°F) and the coldest is January at 12°C (54°F) with the most daily sunshine hours at 11 in August. The wettest month is November with an average of 115mm of rain.

The climate of Costa del Sol in the winter is cool with mean temperatures in the night falling to 8 degrees in December. In the day time temperatures reach a maximum of 17 degrees. Later in the year temperatures in Costa del Sol in March reach 20 degrees by day falling over night to 8 degrees celcius. In June the Costa del Sol temperature is in the range of 17 and 28 degrees before the Costa del Sol climate begins to cool in September when the mean maximum temp is just 27 degrees. At this time of the year the mean low temp is in the region of 19 degrees.

After winter, spring is the wettest season of the year in the Costa del Sol, but as time passes, the probability of rainfall decreases. March is the wettest month, when an average of 59mm of rainfall occurs over the course of 12 days. This drops down to 40mm over 11 days in April and 23mm over eight days in May.

Summer is the driest season of the year for the Costa del Sol. June is the wettest month of the season, with an average of 13mm falling over the course of five days, followed by August with 5mm over three days and July (the driest month) with just 2mm falling over the course of two days.

The weather and climate in the Costa del Sol is excellent. The Costa del Sol coast of Spain enjoys more than 2,800 hours of sunshine each year with an average annual temperature of 19.3 degrees Celsius.

The average minimum temperature will be 15°C, dipping to its lowest on the morning of Wednesday 14th at 13°C.
